head.title: White Plains: Prisoner To Actor To Prisoner Again

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: White Plains: Prisoner To Actor To Prisoner Again
hedline.hl2: White Plains, N.Y.: Prisoner to Actor to Prisoner Again

block.p: A man who learned acting in prison and appeared on a 2006 episode of ''Law & Order'' after his release was sentenced yesterday to 15 years in prison for a new series of robberies in which he threatened to blow himself up if his demands were not met. The man, David Wayne, 48, of Croton-on-Hudson, admitted in State Supreme Court that he had claimed to be wrapped in dynamite while robbing Westchester County stores and hotels last year. The ''dynamite'' was actually road flares. Mr. Wayne pleaded guilty in April to robbery.
